sen.j: 久津川駅（くつかわえき）は、京都府城陽市にある、近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Joyo City of Kyoto Prefecture, Kutsukawa Station is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation Line.
Located in Joyo City of Kyoto Prefecture, Kutsukawa Station is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation line.
Located in Joyo City of Kyoto Prefecture, Kutsukawa Station is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of the Kintetsu Corporation.

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.
It's an aboveground station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.
It's an aboveground station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.
Platforms have an effective length to accommodate six cars.
Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.
Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.

sen.j: 互いのホームを結ぶ地下道や跨線橋が存在しないため、上下線で別々に改札口が設けられている。
sen.e: Separate ticket gates are installed for up train and down train platforms as an underpass or overpass does not exit.
Separate ticket gates are installed for the up-train and down-train platforms, since there is neither an underpass nor an overpass.
Separate ticket gates are installed for the up-train and down-train platforms, since there is neither an underpass nor an overpass.

sen.j: 改札口は上下線ホームとも、ホームの大和西大寺寄りにある。
sen.e: Ticket gates of both up train and down train platforms are located at the end of the platform nearer Yamato-Saidaiji.
Ticket gates of both the up train and down train platforms are located at the end of the platform nearer to Yamato-Saidaiji.
Ticket gates of both the up train and down train platforms are located at the end of the platform nearer to Yamato-Saidaiji.

sen.j: なお自動改札機は東芝製が設置されている。
sen.e: Automated ticket gates installed are of Toshiba manufacture.
The automated ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.
The automated ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.

sen.j: 赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: Red colored automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting and PiTaPa Card and ICOCA Card compatible.
The red-colored automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting, and they're compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.
The red-colored automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting, and they're compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は8,278人。
sen.e: Results of a survey conducted on Nov. 8, 2005 revealed that the number of passengers who got on or off at this station on that day was 8,278.
The results of a survey conducted on November 8, 2005 revealed that 8,278 passengers got on or off at this station that day.
The results of a survey conducted on November 8, 2005 revealed that 8,278 passengers got on or off at this station that day.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、84位。
sen.e: Ranked 84th amongst all Kintetsu stations (323 station as of day of survey) subject to the survey.
It ranked eighty-fourth among all Kintetsu stations (a total of 323) subject to the survey.
It ranked eighty-fourth among all Kintetsu stations (a total of 323 on that date) subject to the survey.

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、15位。
sen.e: Ranked 15th amongst stations on Kyoto Line (26 including Yamato-Saidaiji Station.)
It ranked fifteenth among stations on the Kyoto Line (a total of 26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It ranked fifteenth among stations on the Kyoto Line (a total of 26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、13位。
sen.e: Ranked 13th amongst (23) Kintetsu stations in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked thirteenth among 23 Kintetsu stations in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked thirteenth among 23 Kintetsu stations in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 城陽市立久津川小学校
1928年（昭和3年）11月3日 奈良電気鉄道桃山御陵前駅～西大寺（現・大和西大寺駅）間開通時に開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated when the section of Nara Electric Railway between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji Station (now Yamato-Saidaiji Station) commenced operations on Nov. 3, 1828.
It was inaugurated when the section of Nara Electric Railway between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji Station (now Yamato-Saidaiji Station) and commenced operations on Nov. 3, 1828.
November 3, 1928: The station was inaugurated when the section between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji Station (now Yamato-Saidaiji Station) on the Nara Electric Railway commenced operations.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 会社合併により近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Kintetsu Corporation station on Oct. 1, 1963 as a result of amalgamation.
It became a Kintetsu Corporation station on Oct. 1, 1963 as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1963: The station became a Kintetsu Corporation station as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: Use of PiTaPa Cards commenced on April 1, 2007.
PiTaPa card usage commenced on April 1, 2007.
April 1, 2007: The use of PiTaPa cards commenced.

sen.cmt: 準急→Semi Express 普通→Local・を/に変更しました。

sen.j: 大久保駅 (京都府) - 久津川駅 - 寺田駅 (京都府)
sen.e: Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Kutsukawa Station - Terada Station - (Kyoto Prefecture)
Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Kutsukawa Station - Terada Station - (Kyoto Prefecture)
Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Kutsukawa Station - Terada Station - (Kyoto Prefecture)
